task: How to Make a Cake Using a Pressure Cooker
step: Pour 1 cup (240 ml) of water in the insert.
Lower the pan into the cooker.
Put the lid on the cooker and seal it shut.
Set the cooker to the cake or high setting.
Adjust the temperature according to the type of cake you're making.
Set the bake time for half of the normal time.
Release the pressure for 10 minutes.
Check the cake for doneness.
Let your cake cool for 5 minutes and lift it out.

task: How to Bake a Cake Using a Jiko
step: Cream the margarine with sugar for 1 to 2 minutes.
Beat in 3 eggs 1 at a time.
Stir in the flour, baking powder, and salt.
Mix in the vanilla and milk.
Stir in cocoa if you'd like to make the swirled marble cake.
Grease the smaller sufuria.
Alternate the vanilla and chocolate batter in the pan to make stripes.
Heat the jiko.
Heat the larger sufuria for 5 to 10 minutes.
Put the cake pan in the sufuria and cover it with a lid and charcoal.
Bake the covered cake for 50 to 60 minutes.
Take the sufuria out of the jiko and cool the cake in the sufuria.
Serve the zebra cake.

task: How to Make a Scottish Whisky Dundee Cake
step: Weigh the fruit and peel and place into a bowl, sprinkling it with the 3 tablespoons (44.4 ml) whiskey.
Mix well, cover and leave overnight.
Preheat the oven to gas mark 3, 325°F or 170°C.
Put the butter and sugar in a mixing bowl and beat with a wooden spoon until light and fluffy.
Whisk the eggs separately then, a little at a time, beat them into the creamed butter and sugar.
Fold in the sifted flour and baking powder carefully, using a large tablespoon.
Add a dessertspoon of milk if the mixture seems too dry.
Fold in the ground almonds, currants, sultanas, cherries, mixed peel and orange and lemon rinds carefully.
Grease the cake tin and line it with greaseproof paper.
Spoon the mixture into the prepared cake tin, smoothing it out evenly with the back of the spoon.
Arrange the whole blanched almonds in circles on the top of the mixture, if you don't intend to ice the cake.
Place the cake in the centre of the oven and bake for 2-21/2 hours or until the centre is firm and springy to touch.
Let the cake cool in the tin for 30 minutes before taking it out to finish cooling on a wire rack.
Feed it, wrap it in double greaseproof paper and store it in foil or an airtight container 'till needed.
Finished.

task: How to Prepare Cream for Cake
step: Chill the mixing bowl, whisk attachment, and sugar in your refrigerator.
Mix sugar, heavy or whipping cream, vanilla, and salt in a bowl.
Beat the cream at high speed to thicken the mixture.
Add 8 ounces (230 g) of cream cheese.
Turn off the mixer and scrape the cream off the bowl and whisk.
Whip the cream on high to make a light and fluffy frosting.
Refrigerate the frosting immediately.

task: How to Make Cake Doughnuts
step: Mix the salt, sugar, flour, and baking powder in a separate bowl.
Add the eggs, butter, vanilla extract, and milk into another bowl and whisk well.
Incorporate the dry mixture into the liquid mixture slowly and stir well.
Let the dough rise.
Roll the dough out on a flour-coated surface until the dough is 1/2-inch thick.
Cut the dough into 3-inch circles.
Pour the oil into a skillet and heat it to 360°F (182°C).
Place the doughnuts into the hot oil, taking caution not to splash it.
Flip them over after 60 seconds, or until one side turns golden-brown.
Remove them from the skillet with tongs, a wooden spoon, or chopsticks.
Place the doughnuts onto a plate layered with two paper towels.
Make and apply the glaze to the doughnuts.
Add cinnamon, sugar, icing, or any other toppings.

task: How to Make a Twelfth Night Cake
step: Pre-heat the oven to 150 °C (302 °F).
Grease and line a 25cm/10in cake tin with buttered greaseproof paper.
Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy.
Whisk the eggs with brandy/rum and beat gradually into the creamed mixture.
Sift the flour and spices and add a little at a time to the mixture.
Add the fruit and nuts (plus the pea and bean) and mix thoroughly.
Put the mixture into the cake tin, smooth the top and make a slight hollow in the centre.
Bake for 3-3.5 hours.
Leave to cool in the tin for 15 minutes and then complete cooling on a wire rack.
Serve the cake wrapped into a paper gold crown (to represent the three kings).

task: How to Adjust a Cake Recipe for High Altitude
step: Substitute solid shortening such as lard, which holds more liquid, in the place of margarine.
Add in an extra egg, if egg is an ingredient, in the cake recipe.
Avoid over-beating the eggs with a whisk to avoid adding too much air.
Reduce baking powder, if present in recipe, for each teaspoon or milliliter decreasing by 1/8.
Reduce sugar, if present in recipe, for each cup or milliliter by 1/16.
Increase liquid, if present in recipe, for each cup or milliliter by 1/8 or 1/4.

task: How to Bake an Eastern German Basic Cake
step: Combine the margarine, sugar, and salt in a mixing bowl.
Crack the eggs, separate them, and add the egg yolks into the bowl.
Add flour, milk, baking soda/powder, and lemon juice.
Use a sieve for the flour mix, starting with 50% of the flour amount , and give it to (1).
Stir the mixture until the texture resembles ice cream(2), and give the rest of flour mix to (2).
If you are making a nut or fruit cake variation, this is the time to add in the extra ingredients.
Remember to combine thoroughly.
If the cake mass is too sticky, stir in about 1/2 cup of water.
Pour the mixture into a baking pan.
Bake for about 35 minutes in a 350 °F oven (about 175 C).
Cool on a wire rack or set it near an open window.
Decorate the cake once it is cool to the touch.
Finished.

task: How to Make Snowball Cake
step: Soften gelatin in cold water.
Add boiling water.
Stir to dissolve completely.
Add orange juice, lemon juice and sugar.
Stir until sugar is dissolved.
Refrigerate until thick as egg white.
Whip one pint (2 cups) whipping cream, using chilled bowl and beaters.
Fold into thickened gelatin mixture.
Coat sides of 3 qt.
Break angel food cake into 1 inch (2.5 cm) pieces.
Chill overnight or 6 to 8 hours.
Invert onto cake plate and frost with 1/2 pint (1 cup) cream whipped.
Cover generously with coconut.
Finished.

task: How to Make a Homemade Suzy Q
step: Preheat an oven to 350 °F (177 °C).
Sift and blend the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder and salt.
Add the butter and granulated sugar into the mixture until the mixture is light and fluffy.
Blend into the mixture the eggs, vanilla extract, water and milk.
Beat the mixture until it combines.
Pour the batter into a mini-loaf or cupcake pan until the pan is 1/2 to 3/4 full from the bottom.
Bake these cakes for 35-40 minutes.
Let these cakes cool for a substantial amount of time on a wire rack.
Cut these cakes in half lengthwise with a serrated knife.
Combine all ingredients needed to prepare the Suzy Q filling.
Blend these ingredients together.
Stop blending the frosting ingredients together until they appear smooth and creamy.
Cover one side of the cakes with a good dousing of the frosting to completely cover it.
Place another "cake" on top of the frosting-covered side of the initial cake.
Finish preparing and serve your finished Suzy Q candy bar.

Stir the ingredients for a few minutes (2-3) until they are mixed really well.
Place the bowl into the oven and bake for 30-40 minutes.

Poke small holes all over the cake with the back of a wooden spoon.

Cover the cake with whipped cream.
Crush the heath bars and sprinkle them on the cake.

Combine into this mixture the milk and vanilla needed, but don't stop blending while doing so.

Spoon about 1 Tbsp.

task: How to Make an Apricot and Walnut Cake (Vegan)
step: Preheat the oven to 390ºF (200ºC) and line or grease your cake pan.
Mix the flour, mashed potato flakes, sugar and baking powder in the mixing bowl.
Add the ground almonds, coconut milk and pureed apple to the dry ingredients.
Mix all the ingredients together to combine them well until they form a smooth batter.
Add the apricots and walnuts and mix through quickly.
Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
Place the cake in the preheated oven and bake it for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean.
Remove the cake from the oven when it's done and allow it to cool on a wire cooling rack.
Unmold the cake and place it on your serving dish when it's completely cooled to room temperature.
Cut the cake into portions and serve.

task: How to Make a Milky Way Cake
step: Assemble the ingredients and items needed.
Heat up the double boiler.
Cream the sugar with the other stick of butter.
Pour the melted Milky Way bars into the creamed butter and sugar mixture.
Add the egg yolks, one at a time.
Add the baking soda to a little buttermilk and stir to dissolve.
Alternately pour in the flour and the remaining buttermilk to the batter.

Fold the batter into the beaten egg whites.
Pour the batter into the prepared cake pan.
Place the cake into the oven.

task: How to Bake Butterfly Cakes
step: Preheat the oven to 180˚C/350˚F/Gas 4.
Put the caster sugar and margarine together in a mixing bowl and beat until a pale creamy-colour.
Crack the eggs into a measuring jug and briefly whisk round with a fork.
Add a small amount of the self-raising flour to the mix and fold in using the same ‘Figure of 8’ method.
Fold until the mixture is light and creamy.
Insert a skewer or a sharp knife once golden-brown in colour into the biggest cake: if this comes out clean then the cakes are ready!.
Wait for the butterfly cakes to cool down.
Cut a small circle out of each cake and scoop out.
Place a large knob of butter into a mixing bowl and sift the icing sugar in.
Using a teaspoon, scoop the buttercream mixture into the cakes, placing the two halves base-down on top to form the ‘wings’.
Add a sprinkle of icing sugar and you have your finished cakes!.

task: How to Make Austrian Sponge Cake with Cherries and Meringue
step: Separate the egg yolks from the egg whites.
Beat the yolks with sugar, oil and baking powder in a tall plastic container.
Beat the egg whites with a pinch of salt in another bowl.
Use a wooden spoon to gradually add the egg whites to the bowl with the egg yolks from top to bottom.
Add the flour and mix it in gently with a wooden spoon.
Pour the mixture into a pan greased with oil and dusted with flour.
Top the mixture with cherries dusted with a little flour.
Place the mixture in the oven over low heat for 25-30 minutes.
Make the meringue.
When the cake has finished cooking, remove it from the oven and top it with the meringue.
Place it in the oven for another 15 minutes until it's browned on top.
Serve.

task: How to Bake a Black Cake
step: Soak the fruit.
Prepare your supplies and ingredients.

task: How to Make Neiman Marcus Cake
step: Pre-heat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).
Mix the box of Duncan Hines butter cake mix, 2 eggs, and 1 stick of butter.
Pour the mixed batter into a greased and floured 13 x 9 inch pan.
Wet fingers and press gently into the bottom of the pan to make sure there is no air on the bottom of the pan.
Soften the cream cheese on the stove or in the microwave.
Combine the cream cheese, box of powdered sugar (save enough to sift on top of finished cake)2 eggs and 1 tsp.
Mix these ingredients until smooth.
Pour this mix of the cake batter in the pan and smooth.
Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes or until the middle is brown and bubbling.
Sift powdered sugar evenly on top.
Cut into squares and serve when cooled.
Finished.

task: How to Make Butter‐Rum Walnut Cake
step: Prepare the fruit.
Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit or 162° Celsius.
Grease a large cake pan with non-stick greasing spray.
In a large mixing bowl, whisk the brown sugar, butter, baking powder, salt, molasses, nutmeg, vanilla, and allspice.
Crack in each egg, one at a time, and whisk.
Add the flour and mix slowly, pouring in the milk.
Stir in the walnuts, candied cherries, and microwaved fruit mixture.
Pour and scrape out the batter into the greased cake pan.
Bake the cake for about 60-90 minutes, until the cake is golden brown.
Remove the cake from the oven and allow it cool for several minutes.
Brush the cake with the simple syrup using a pastry brush.
Let the cake sit for about 45 minutes so the syrup can soak into the cake.
Serve.

task: How to Make a Malteser Cake
step: Boil a pot of water.
Grease the pan.
Crush the digestive cookies.
Add the butter.
Put in some milk chocolate.
Add the treacle to the butter and chocolate bowl.
Put the treacle, butter, and chocolate bowl inside of the pot with the boiling water.
Add the crushed cookies to the melted treacle, butter, and chocolate.
Add some Maltesers.
Scoop the mixture into the pan.
Refrigerate the mixture.
Add the rest of the Maltesers.
Let it cool.

task: How to Make a Cake Without Scales
step: Before starting, turn on the oven to preheat at 360F/180C.
Arrange the pear slices on top of the maple syrup.
Make the cake batter.
Take the mixture off the heat immediately the butter melts.
Add in the beaten egg and mix well.
Toss in the flour and combine till there are no lumps.
Pour the batter over the sliced pears.
As soon as it cools down enough to handle, upturn the cake onto a serving platter.
Enjoy as is, or with cream or ice-cream.

task: How to Make Sachertorte
step: Preheat the oven to 170 degrees.
Melt 175 g. of the chocolate.
Mix the butter with the sugar until soft.
Separate the eggs.
Beat the egg whites with a pinch of salt.
Smear some butter into a suitable cake pan and dust with normal flour.
Heat the confiture till it's fluid.
Take your cake out of the mould and smear the top with the warm confiture.
Melt the rest of the chocolate au bain marie, add the icing sugar and a spoonful of butter.
Finished.

task: How to Make Lime, Coconut and Almond Cake
step: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F).
Separate the eggs.
Grate three teaspoons of lime from the limes and put aside.
Mix the almonds, coconut, flour, 1 tsp of the grated lime, baking powder and salt in the medium bowl.
Beat the granulated sugar and then the vanilla essences into the egg yolks.
Fold the almond mixture in.
Wash egg beaters or whisk well and dry thoroughly.
Pour the mixture into the cake pan and smooth.
Place in the center of the oven and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until a skewer comes out clean.
Add icing.
Remove the cake from the oven and leave to sit on a wire cooling rack for 10 minutes to cool.
Put the cake on its serving plate and add the icing.

task: How to Make Galette Des Rois
step: Beat the butter with a fork until it becomes creamy.
Add the lightly beaten eggs, bitter almond extract and orange flower water.
Heat the oven to 200ºC/400ºF.
Mix the egg yolk with the milk.
Lay out a length of puff pastry on a non-stick baking sheet.
Spread the almond cream, leaving the edge of the pastry sheet free from cream.
Lay the second sheet of puff pastry over the first.
Make a small hole in the middle of the galette so that the cake does not swell too much when cooking.
Draw a design on the surface of he cake with the blunt side of a knife.
Brush the entire surface with the egg-milk mixture, passing over it twice.
Place the cake into the oven and cook it for about 25 minutes.
Finished.

task: How to Make Barm Brack
step: Put the yeast, sugar and milk together in a bowl; beat until the milk becomes frothy.
Put the flour, sugar and spice in a separate bowl, and then incorporate the butter with your fingers.
Pour the milk mixture into the bowl with the flour, and beat the ingredients together for 5 minutes, or until dough forms.
Knead the dough for two minutes, then work in the fruit and salt.
Place the dough in a warm bowl, cover with a towel, and allow it to rise for an hour or until it has doubled in size.
Knead the dough again and place in a floured/greased 8 inch (20.3 cm) diameter cake pan; allow an extra 25 minutes of rising time.
Bake at 400 °F (204 °C) on the top rack of the oven, for 30-45 minutes or until toothpick inserted into the cake's center comes out clean.
Glaze the finished cake with a simple sugar syrup made from 2 teaspoons of sugar dissolved in 3 teaspoons of boiling water, if you like.
Finished.

task: How to Make a Christmas Cake
step: Roll out the marzipan with a rolling pin so that you can over the top of the cake with it in a moment.
Brush the cake with the warmed apricot jam.
Beat the egg whites and sugar in a mixing bowl on high speed until soft peaks form, which takes about 5 minutes.
Spread the icing over the cake using an offset spatula.
Decorate the cake with Christmas ornaments or dried fruit and nuts.
Served.

task: How to Make a Simnel Cake
step: Preheat the oven to 140ºC.
Rub the butter in with the sugar.
Add the flour and the chopped fruits.
Pour half of the cake batter into the prepared cake pan.
Mix the almond paste ingredients together.
Place a thin layer of almond paste over the batter.
Pour the second half of the batter over the almond paste layer.
Place in the oven.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool.
Cover the cake with almond paste.
Remove and decorate.
